intro: Xolisma heptamera, commonly known as the seven-flowered xolisma, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Xolisma heptamera is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
